requirement.metadata

Class TextAnnotator

  • java.lang.Object
    • requirement.metadata.TextAnnotator

  • public class TextAnnotator
extends java.lang.Object
    Manage annotated text; that is raw text which has certain words / phrases highlighted (and thus becomes XHTML)
    Author:
    Moritz Dorka

    • Method Detail

      • addAnnotation

        public void addAnnotation(int startOffset,
                          int endOffset,
                          Annotator annotator)
        Add a new annotation
        Parameters:
        startOffset - character offset at which this annotation begins (0-based), inclusive
        endOffset - character offset at which this annotation ends (0-based), exclusive
        annotator - Annotator to use for this annotation (i.e. the type of this annotation)

      • getAnnotatedText

        public java.lang.String getAnnotatedText()
        Returns:
        a XHTML-formatted string containing all the annotations; never null

      • getNumberOfAnnotations

        public int getNumberOfAnnotations(Annotator... filters)
        Count the number of annotations managed by this class
        Parameters:
        filters - Array of annotations; if set only annotations of this type will be counted
        Returns:
        the number of annotations which are currently being managed

      • findElementaryIntervals

        private void findElementaryIntervals(int startOffset,
                                     int endOffset,
                                     java.util.SortedSet<TextAnnotator.AnnotationRun> applicableAnnotations,
                                     XmlStringWriter outputWriter)
        Finds groups of overlapping annotations and processes each group individually
        Parameters:
        startOffset - startOffset from where to process the underlying string; 0-based; inclusive
        endOffset - endOffset until where to process the underlying string; 0-based; exclusive
        applicableAnnotations - annotations to process
        outputWriter - writer where the text and rendered annotations shall end up

      • splitNestedStructures

        private void splitNestedStructures(int startOffset,
                                   int endOffset,
                                   java.util.SortedSet<TextAnnotator.AnnotationRun> nestedAnnotations,
                                   XmlStringWriter outputWriter)
        Splits overlapping annotations
        Parameters:
        startOffset - startOffset from where to process the underlying string; 0-based; inclusive
        endOffset - endOffset until where to process the underlying string; 0-based; exclusive
        nestedAnnotations - annotations to process
        outputWriter - writer where the text and rendered annotations shall end up
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the nestedAnnotations were empty
